com.toolrental.util

Class DateUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.toolrental.util.DateUtils

  • public class DateUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class providing methods to determine if a given date falls on a weekend or a recognized holiday.

    This class includes methods to check if a particular DayOfWeek represents a weekend day, as well as to identify if a specific LocalDate is a recognized holiday such as Independence Day or Labor Day in the United States.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $Date: 2024/12/03 12:00:00
    Author:
    Michael Escott

      • isWeekend

        public static boolean isWeekend(java.time.DayOfWeek day)
        Determines if the given DayOfWeek represents a weekend day (Saturday or Sunday).
        Parameters:
        day - the DayOfWeek to check
        Returns:
        true if the day is Saturday or Sunday, false otherwise

      • isHoliday

        public static boolean isHoliday(java.time.LocalDate date)
        Determines if the provided LocalDate is a recognized holiday.

        The method checks two holidays:

        • Independence Day (July 4th) â€” adjusted if it falls on a Saturday or Sunday.
        • Labor Day (first Monday of September).

        Parameters:
        date - the LocalDate to check
        Returns:
        true if the date is either Independence Day or Labor Day, false otherwise
